Fields.DialogueText: What's that smell? Is that the smell of soap flakes?
Heya, Cap. Say, what's got you so entranced?
Hull? Is... is that you? It's good, but it's really strong.
You mean my lavender perfume? Yeah, it's my favorite. The crew will tell you they always know when I'm coming. They can smell me from a mile away.

Fields.MenuText: Do you always wear perfume?
It's nice, but won't the Morganas sense it?
Maybe the crew is referring to how loud you are when you walk?

Fields.DialogueText: I never leave home without it. Gotta cut the gunsmoke with something.
Some of them have keen sniffers, but by the time they do they're in my sights. Then... bang.
I trained the stomp out of these feet before I even awoke. Can't bag any prey otherwise.
It's not too cloying, is it?
Good! That means it's working.
Nice to have a Belle with a good sense of atmosphere.
Too much and the prey notices the trick and flies the coop. Too little and they don't stop and smell the roses.
The lavender.
Not at all. It brightens the air right up.
*ALARM*
Heh. Good one, Cap, but they all drop the same when I pull the trigger.
@BATTLE
What's wrong, Miss Hull?
It's not. I'm just... missing my sisters, I guess.
You're pretty close to them?
I got seven. The ladies of the Farragut class. I can't stand being away from them.

Fields.MenuText: I know how that is. I'm from a close family myself.
I think you make your own family in life.
Are you a middle child?

Fields.DialogueText: You really get used to a big pack of siblings.
It comes and it goes. But there's nothing quite like the sisters you're born with.
Yes, Farragut is the oldest and Dale is the baby. Two older, five younger.
Were all your sisters also from Brooklyn?
Dale was. A couple were from Boston, Quincy, Philadelphia... other places like that.
We all served out of San Diego before the war spread us out. Those were the days...
*ALARM*
We'll get you all back together again.
@BATTLE
*SPLASH*
How could you tell?
That buoy was... what, a thousand feet away? It's not like you to miss at that range.
I'd appreciate that, Cap. That's what we're trying to do for you humans.
Yeah.
Can't keep away, Cap. A little stand hunting always calms me down when I'm antsy.
I don't get too busted up about our chances. We can take anything that comes our way.
Then what brings you up here? Sounds like you can take any fight anywhere.
It reminds me of home. The hunt, I mean.
Not a lot of hunting to be had at the New York Navy Yard.
Something to look forward to when this is all over, then. I bet you'd love a good hunt.
Nothing is set in stone, but I'm thinking about taking a moose up in Alaska. Doesn't that sound keen?

Fields.MenuText: To hit moose, you'll have to make a long shot from the deck.
What about a sea lion?
Why not a predator?

Fields.DialogueText: Ain't nobody got a better shot than yours truly. I once hit a single wing off a fly with a twenty-two caliber.
Sea lions are too easy. They just lay there at the shore. It's worse than shooting fish in a barrel. At least those swim around.
See, it's counterintuitive. You'd think killing predators would mean more prey, but it's the opposite.
*ALARM*
Looks like the relaxing part's out of the way.
It can't always be smooth sailing. Just ask the moose.
@BATTLE
I thought I might find you up here again.
Still thinking about your sisters?
They're always there. But I'm talking about the wait.
It does get tense before a battle. You never know who's going to pull the trigger first.
But our strategy can change in a split second. Makes every second before that seem like an eternity.
No, but it's a part of me anyway. My namesake knew when to fire and when to hold his fire. And everyone hunted back then. I guess it keeps me grounded in home.
Hmm... Alaska or Maine?
I'm not much of a hunter. What do you plan on doing with it?
I'm going to eat it, silly. Do you know how big a loin is on a moose? I also want to mount his head over the fireplace.
There aren't any fireplaces on this ship.
Not right now, there aren't. I want that hunting lodge and trophy room feel. That type of rustic decor will be a great backdrop for my flower collection.
Bit of an odd hobby for a hunter to have.
Not really. Spend enough time in nature and you'll want to take some of it back with you. Within reason, of course.

Fields.MenuText: What flower is your favorite?
I'm still trying to understand how you appreciate something you've never done.
Just how big is a loin on a moose?

Fields.DialogueText: I like hydrangeas and the red hot poker from the Azores, but nothing beats the smell of lavender.
Belle. I was built with a little New England in me. Kind of like patriotism, but a little more... concrete.
At least six pounds, and there are two of them. I figure my whole complement could at least get a bite of the beast.
For someone who hasn't been hunting, you're sure talking me into it.
It's almost like a religious experience. It's mostly waiting, but there's that rush of adrenaline when you see your game come into range.
Moose hunt.
What do you mean?
*ALARM*
I think I see what you mean.
Mmm... nah. Moose don't shoot back.
@BATTLE
There's nothing quite like that adrenaline rush, when a bull moose steps from out of the brush...
What song is that from?
Made it up. That moose just isn't leaving me alone.
The figurative moose.
Before I take any steps like that, I need to get a call.
Moose have calls?
It's not any old buck grunt, either. It's more like a cow moose bleat for a male. Hopefully a male comes, but even then they can take their sweet time to arrive.
He has a big rack, with seventeen tines, have him in the crosshairs where he'll be mine...

Fields.MenuText: Do you always sing about hunting?
I've never been one for hunting.
You're not going to catch anything if they hear you singing.

Fields.DialogueText: Only when I'm excited about it. Which is always.
Aldo Leopold says it's a good way to preserve the balance of nature. And he's a conservationist, so he would know.
Wolves don't howl at their prey. I know what I'm doing, Cap.
Only thing better is some good old New York cheesecake.
*ALARM*
Hunting's all about timing.
@BATTLE
If the opportunity comes up to patrol Alaskan waters, I'll be sure to volunteer you.
Only kind I've seen. So far.
Just when you gave me about a dozen more questions.
Hello there, Hull. I hope the day's treating you well!
Mm-hm!
From the looks of things, I'm guessing it is?
MMM-mm. Had a mouthful, there, Cap, sorry. This cheesecake needed proper attention.
Far be it from me to stop you. That looks divine.
It is, doll. The velvety texture, the crumbly, sugary graham cracker crust... This is something worth fighting for.
We came all the way to New York for a slice of cheesecake?
I don't see anything wrong with that picture. But I was really wanting to get a new scope for my rifle. There's the Carl Zeiss store over on 5th Avenue.
Why not the new 8x Winchester scope?
Hey, if Carl Zeiss is good enough for planetary viewing in Chicago, it's good enough for Miss Hull here. I sent one of the officers shopping.

Fields.MenuText: Can't go wrong with Zeiss.
I might test that Winchester against your Zeiss.

Fields.DialogueText: Say what you will about those Germans. They know their optics.
I never say no to a challenge. Especially not one that proves my point.
Ooh, just wait until my sisters get a look at that scope...
*ALARM*
I hope that officer comes back with my scope soon.
You're not going to have time to sight it in before battle.
If it's just one more fight, I can settle for almost perfect.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: They ought to sponsor you.

Fields.DialogueText: You'd think business types would be knocking my door down. Especially during a war.
Competitive family?
All in good fun, Cap. We try and show off the niftiest finds from our travels. Aylwin's got this stamp collection you wouldn't believe.
*BANG*
Who's shooting on deck? Is there a battle happening? Did I sleep through it?
Hold your horses, Cap. I'm just sighting in my new scope. Hmm... I'm still up and to the right by an inch and a half, methinks.
Let's just move it one click down and one click to the left...
A click?
400 yards a click is a minute of angle with this scope. One click is one inch at 400 yards, where I intend to shoot.
*BANG*
How'd I do this time?
Looks like I got my new scope all sighted in with ammunition to spare. Look at this, Cap - there's a drop-down plate where the magazine comes out.

Fields.MenuText: That'll come in handy.
That just seems like a luxury.
I don't know the first thing about hunting equipment.

Fields.DialogueText: Won't it? Sure beats moving the bolt repeatedly to get the spare rounds out.
What type of rifle do you have? I like not having to move the action around to unload mine.
It's a bit different than the heavy artillery of a destroyer like myself, but you can pick up on it in no time.
Ooh, my sisters are going to be so jealous when I write them!
All seven of them?
I don't want to leave anyone out. Especially Worden. She's been bragging to anyone who'll listen about her new sword...
*ALARM*
One more thing to include in my letter.
@BATTLE
Bullseye.
Grr. One more time and I'll scream.
What's wrong, Miss Hull?
Oh, the older destroyers are bent out of shape because of my design. I'm faster and better armed, not to mention a damn sight more comfortable.

Fields.MenuText: There've been advances since your ship was commissioned.
They're just jealous. Don't let them rain on your parade.
You'll hear no complaining from me about the living spaces.

Fields.DialogueText: Propaganda. Some things you need to know when you've struck gold. Er... when you've nailed it.
It's hard to not be upset by it. Then again, what are they going to do? Chase after me?
I better not! I've half a mind to make the crew clean their quarters top to bottom. That'll show those Clemsons who's shiny.
Why do you think the older ships call you "Goldpla..."
UURRGGGG.
Sorry, sorry. Why do the older destroyers call you that? If anyone's to blame for your design, it's... well, us.
Probably because of the time I spend in the Pacific now. The Somers girls were built specifically for the Pacific theatre, but because I have this revolutionary design, I go where I am most needed.
Glad you're on my side, Captain. We've got better things to do than lord our designs over each other.
But didn't you-
Better. Things.
*ALARM*
I'll show those old destroyers what I'm made of. Speaking of better things...
@BATTLE
Belle interview in the Times. Some stuck-up Clemson-class called me a goldplater again.
What on earth is that?
So they're afraid of being upstaged. Prima donnas.
I just love the exotic flowers here. Panama might be my favorite place outside of New York.
This canal seems like a tight fit. Can you make it?
Cutting-edge girl like me? Piece of cake. I've made the trek before. Now take a gander at this gem.
Is that a flower?
Yep. It's a Heliconias. It's evolved alongside hummingbirds - only hummingbirds are able to pollinate the flower.
Look at the beautiful shape of the petals and the pink and lime colors. They look like lion claws, don't you think?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know much about flowers.
Now there's a good beast to hunt.
Flowers never interested me all that much.

Fields.DialogueText: It's like ships or arms or anything else. There are classes of flowers and some of have evolved according to a specific design.
Maybe if we swing by Africa. Not really sure how lion would taste, though.
Who doesn't like flowers? Do you suffer from... what's the name for it again... hay fever? Do you suffer from hay fever? That's got to be it.
We're kind of like that, aren't we?
What?
The hummingbird and the flower. Because we work so well together.
*ALARM*
Oh, dear, looks like we've got a fight on our hands.
Damn it, don't just leave me hanging...
@BATTLE
So who's who?
Well, I figure the one who's the hummingbird would be... uh, that is...
*BANG*
I thought you already sighted in your rifle.
I did. I'm just practicing with it now.
What are you even shooting at? Seals?
I thought we went over this. Seals are so slow and they just lie there like lumps on the coast. I'm practicing on some bottles.
I don't even see them...
Watch.
*BANG*
See Cap? Ain't no one who can outshoot me. I took out that beer bottle at 400 yards. A big moose won't be any kind of problem.

Fields.MenuText: That's a great shot.
I could easily shoot that.
Are you sure there's even a beer bottle there?

Fields.DialogueText: Innate ability only gets me so far. Even a Belle has to practice to stay sharp.
PFFTTT. I think you're lying through your teeth. The kickback alone would make you miss.
There was until very recently.
I've thought about an answer to your question, incidentally.
Oh?
At first I thought you were the flower and I was the hummingbird in this metaphor. The whole command thing, I mean. But then I figured it was the other way around.
It's you Belles that are driving the response to the Morganas. You're the hummingbird inspiring humanity to reach the full flower of victory.
That's pretty swell, Captain. We make a good team that way.
I'm glad it makes sense to you.
I'm glad it wasn't as weird as it initially sounded.
W-what!?
*ALARM*
Awright, I'm a hummingbird. Time to hum.
@BATTLE
Oooh, look at this, Cap.
I can't see it - what is it?
It's camouflage. Must be why you can't see it.

Fields.MenuText: HA! That was the joke.
That's not funny at all.
I don't get it.

Fields.DialogueText: Long walk for a short drink of water. But a man in the desert, and all that.
There for a minute I thought you were making a joke. Take the win, Captain.
That's all right, Captain. Just leave the hunting and the humor to me.
Now, I think I'd look just glamorous in this camouflage pattern. It looks just like a forest floor.
I don't think a moose is going to see that.
Of course he ain't going to see it. It's camouflage.
I mean, I think the moose is going to see this big ship long before your camouflage will matter.
Hmm... you're right.
Yes, you've made me realize there's something this ship needs before I can embark on my moose hunt.
What am I right about?
We got a comedian here. No, I need to camouflage the entire ship.
*ALARM*
Would it fool the Morganas?
If I did it right. A forest floor in the middle of the ocean would raise some eyebrows.
@BATTLE
Wheels?
Soon the ship will be outfitted for getting my moose.
Why exactly did we have to stop in Puget Sound? Can't we get the ship painted elsewhere?
We ain't painting it, Cap. I'm getting the ship some clothes.
Clothes?
Yeah. A camouflage jack to slip over the ship when I want to hunt some land creatures. That's easier in the long run than having it painted. Who paints a ship camouflage?
Oh, would you look at that.
What's over there?
It's a killer whale. Boy, would hunting one of those be fun.
Why don't you?
What would I do with it? Have you ever had whale meat? Can you tan the hide? Having a whale head mounted on my figurative fireplace sounds sort of odd, don't you think?
I guess.
In any case, I think I'll stick with traditional game animals for now.

Fields.MenuText: Define traditional game animal?
So the ship is getting a giant jacket?
Why don't you think killer whale meat tastes good?

Fields.DialogueText: You know... deer, elk, moose, turkey, bear. Things you can stuff and eat.
More of a cloak, but you're on the right track.
That would be like eating coyote or bobcat. I don't think predators are tasty like prey animals are. Birds excepted, of course.
*ALARM*
Make sure my ship's hunting jacket doesn't get ruined.
@BATTLE
You're the ship. There's only so much I can do to stop you from getting hit.
True enough. Well, if I can hit a bobbing bottle, I can hit a moving shell.
Finally! That moose call arrived from the mainland. Alaska won't know what hit it.
It looks like a megaphone.
It's similar. You groan in this like so...
Aahhhoowwwwmmm... mwwaaaa...
That's what a moose cow sounds like?
I bet you I could fool any moose with this call.
Wwwwwaaaaaaoooooooowww...
What call is that?
That's a long call. That's a cow who doesn't want to be pestered by the young bloods, so she calls to a bigger mature male to try and come in.

Fields.MenuText: How did you know so much about moose?
Alaska is so cold.
Ought to be plenty of flowers for your collection, too.

Fields.DialogueText: If you want to find your prey, you need to know how to think like them.
Until I see a tropical moose, that's our destination.
There's western columbine, louseworts, violets, iris, vetch... It's quite diverse for the short growing season.
*ALARM*
Uh-oh. Looks like you've attracted a sea moose.
Oh, don't I wish.
@BATTLE
Hull...
Shhh...
Hull.
Yes?
The ship's jacket is very distracting. It's blowing around in the wind.
SHHH. Keep your voice down. I don't want you to scare the moose away.
Can they hear you this far out?
Sound travels very well over water. Wait a second...
MmmaaaAAAOOOOWWWW... moooo-moo.
Be patient. The jacket is only distracting if you keep paying attention to it.
Okay, I'll wait here.
Look. Here comes a bull. Once he's broadside, I'm going to take the shot.
AH-CHOOO.
Darn it all to-! You spooked him.

Fields.MenuText: He could hear me sneeze all the way over there?
Why didn't you take the shot?
If a moose came out that fast, there will be another one soon.

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, sound travels better over water.
A broadside shot is an ethical shot. He wasn't broadside before you spooked him.
It doesn't always happen like that. It's usually a lot of waiting.
There's always next time.
Whenever that might be. Look at that sky. It's mackerel clouds.
I don't understand.
Mackerel sky and mare's tails, lofty ships carry low sails.
Is that good or bad?
It means there are storms on the way. That means fewer moose until the thunder decides to stop.
*ALARM*
Hmph. Prime Morgana weather, though.
@BATTLE
Mammatus clouds. About time.
What does that mean?
Sky's safe. If you see mare's tails, a storm is coming, but if you see mammatus clouds - clouds that look like bosoms - it's safe to come out.
Well past time to tidy my flower collection, anyway. Do you want to see it?
Sure.
I got some time to kill until a high-pressure system comes in.
Here's the British Isles specimens. Some goatsbeard, some heather... oh, this mallow here is pretty.
What are these flowers over here?
Those are flowers from Alaska. I was telling you about the violets earlier.

Fields.MenuText: What do you like about dried flowers so much?
Where would you like to travel to get flowers next?
How many flowers do you want to collect?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a nice, natural way to remember where I've traveled. They look nice on the wall as well.
Burma or Hawaii might be nice. I was supposed to be stationed at Pearl Harbor, but then the Morganas showed up.
Ideally a couple from every country. Some countries have flowers that only bloom once a decade or so. They're top of the list.
I'm surprised a hunter doesn't look for more trophies.
Oh, I want some of those, don't get me wrong. Gotta have a moose's head for the fireplace.
*ALARM*
Different kingdom, different laws, Captain. Now let's blast these Morgs to kingdom come!
@BATTLE
Which we've still yet to build.
The boilers should do if we can't. But I don't take just any trophy. It's more about the pursuit than the prestige for me.
Unless you're on the hunt for flowers.
Look at this moon, Cap.
Is that a rainbow around the moon?
Nah, it's a halo. And you know what they say about moon halos.
What do they say?
Ring round the moon, rain real soon.
Is that true or is that just an old wives' tale?
Well, it's the same as the mare's tails. The halo is caused by the moon light refracting in the ice crystals in the air.

Fields.MenuText: Based on your experience, how many wives' tales are more true than false?
Can you always predict the weather?

Fields.DialogueText: It's hard to say. Some are obviously true, such as "rainbow at noon, rain real soon" because you need a rain to get a rainbow.
Nah, not always. If I could do that, I would be making some big bucks.
One day I'll figure out North America's weather patterns. The hunts should majorly improve once I know where and when to look.
*ALARM*
I have to be waiting for something, Cap. Otherwise I'm just lying around. When did you ever hear of a Belle doing that?
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I always thought those kinds of things were nonsense.

Fields.DialogueText: All the superstitions are based on truth one way or another. You've just got to remember how.
You don't just appreciate the experience of waiting?
Well-
On second thought, don't answer that. I've heard some weird stories.
What's all this mess on the floor? I nearly fell to my death. I'm glad I could smell your perfume.
Oh, cut the drama. That was a stumble at best. I was just cleaning my guns.
You can't do that on a table?
If it's laid out on the deck like this, I find it more organized. I can see everything. If you have any swords, I could probably clean those too.
I wonder how many swords Commodore Hull had to clean back in the day.
I'm sure the answer is more than he would have liked to.
Shame. It's pretty therapeutic. Hey, what's the sky look like?
There are a few clouds.
What kind of clouds are they? Is there a storm coming, or are we okay to not batten down the hatches?

Fields.MenuText: Uhh... looks safe?
Oh, these are some storm clouds.
I'm not a weather station. You have a look.

Fields.DialogueText: You sound very confident.
What kind of storm clouds? Do you see thunderheads windward?
Fine with me. Better safe than sorry.
Let's take a peek at the clouds... ah, it looks safe enough.
*ALARM*
Not for the prey I'd like, that's certain.
@BATTLE
Is it good for a hunt?
But one of these days I'll get you up to speed on the weather.
There's always tomorrow.
Sure is. I've made sure of that.
Hull, did you see that?
See what, Cap?
There was some kind of antelope jumping around the ship. Look behind you!
I don't see any antelope...
Right there! Don't tell me you can't see it.
Ha, ha! No wonder I was confused. It's actually a gemsbok.
Which brings me to my next question. What is a gemsbok doing on the ship? Are you going to hunt it?
I ain't hunting it unless it's fair chase. We are taking this beast to Nova Scotia so I can use it as barter to hunt for a bull moose.

Fields.MenuText: A creature of the savannah in the cold climates of Canada?
Why didn't you put it in a crate?
I don't care for these creatures.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, what the trade wants the trade gets.
If I did that, then the animal would grow anxious. Besides, this gives me a chance to study the creature up close, so I can hunt one later.
It's only until we get to Nova Scotia. I'm keeping an eye on it.
*ALARM*
Make sure the gemsbok doesn't get harmed during battle.
@BATTLE
Hey! This can't be my responsibility.
Only joking, Cap. I'll go stick it in a hold we're not using.
Grr...
What's that sound?
Careful, Captain. I didn't crate the gemsbok, but this one's a different story. I wouldn't trust it to be out on the ship.
Why? What's in there?
A tiger.
A tiger!?
Yeah, don't get too close. They can spray up to 12 feet away.
You're making me miss the gemsbok. At least those don't eat people.
Unfortunately, my contact changed his mind and decided he wanted a tiger instead. I had to find someone willing to trade a tiger for a gemsbok.
Say, while we are here, I can get some plum blossoms and mums! My sisters would really enjoy those.
*ROAR*
Keep your shirt on. I'll have the officer pick up a few hundred pounds of horse meat.
Horse?
Yeah, I've got to feed this tiger here, don't I? Tigers need lean meat like horse. They don't digest fat that well.

Fields.MenuText: Don't let that tiger eat me.
What, exactly, do you mean by... tiger spraying?
I am not a cat person.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't mess with him and he won't mess with you.
If you stand too close to the cage, you'll find out the hard way.
Hey, don't worry. This tiger here won't bother you one bit. It knows better.
*ALARM*
Don't let that tiger get hurt.
Don't let the tiger escape.
@BATTLE
I feel like you're missing the elephant in the room. Sorry, the tiger in the room.
That's what I like about you, Captain. You're a compromising sort.
*ROAR*
I think that tiger needs something to do.
Whatever it is, can it happen in the cage?
I think that will just drive him bonkers. I mean, I can't really leave this ship and that alone gets hard. I can't imagine being kept in a tiny crate.
It's only until we get to Nova Scotia.
Yeah, poor fella...
Maybe the tiger is sick of horse meat already. Try chicken?
Say, whole frozen chickens sounds like a keen idea. Good for several hours' worth of chewing.

Fields.MenuText: As long as it stays put. I don't trust that thing.
How do you know so much about tigers?

Fields.DialogueText: Nor should you. It's mad enough it's on a ship.
They're not in the best shape as a species. The more we know about them, the better a chance we haveto save them.

Fields.MenuText: How do you think the Morganas would handle him?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't even joke about that! He deserves better than being handed to those monsters.
At least he seems to get more agitated when Morganas are near. We can use that.
Poor thing must be scared out of his kitty mind.
@BATTLE
Right. That's the problem.
Oh, don't be that way. I bet it would warm to you if you fed it a chicken.
I think I'll take my chances with the Morganas. I'm allowed to fire on those.
Hull? You okay?
Yeah, I guess so. Leastways, I will be.
I know you didn't get along, but I was really starting to like him.

Fields.MenuText: Whew. With that tiger gone, I can breathe easy again.
Now that he's gone, I sort of miss the fella.
I thought it sounded quiet in here. I haven't heard quiet since before we picked that tiger up.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't breathe too hard, Captain. I don't want you scaring off my moose.
I'll have to write Augusta. Maybe she can spare some furry friends from her menagerie.
Well, no sense dwelling on it if it was part of the plan.
He was upset because he was in a shipping crate. I can't blame him for that.
I guess not. Besides, I can't wait to get started on my moose hunt. I'm going to go put the hunting jacket over the ship. Have you seen my earplugs?
Earplugs?
Yeah, I don't want to develop hearing loss on account of a loud weapon.
Naval battles aren't loud to you?
What did you say? Sorry, I couldn't hear you.
Just kidding. Don't be so grumpy. Learn to take a joke every now and then.
*ALARM*
Okay, now I'm being serious. Where are my earplugs?
@BATTLE
It's the tiger, isn't it.
Aw, that's for the sailors' benefit. I can smell these scavengers coming from miles away.
They're not for the alarm.
I know I put those earplugs somewhere...
I could just purchase some new ones.
I've come too far to just give up. Urg. I'm usually so good about putting things where they belong.
I can hear those older gals now... "Hey, goldplater, how'd that hunt go?" The look on their crummy, obsolete faces...

Fields.MenuText: Where was the last place you put the box?
Are they in the brig?
Are they in the head?

Fields.DialogueText: Last place I remember having them was on my nightstand. I usually keep them there, ready for battle.
I just came from the brig and they ain't there. I'll turn myself upside down if that's what it takes.
Why would they be in there? Although I suppose it wouldn't hurt to check...
Things are usually in the last place you look.
Hey, now THAT definitely sounds like an old wives' tale. Oh look! Here they are.
Where were they?
I put them in a box with the rest of my favorite trinkets. Guess I didn't want to forget where they were. That's irony for you.
I'm just glad you finally found them.
Wait until my sisters hear about this one.
*ALARM*
It's healthy to laugh at things that are funny, Cap. Even yourself.
@BATTLE
You'd tell them about it?
Sit still, Cap... I saw some tracks earlier.
MMAWWWWRROOOO... arrroooooo...
How are things going?
Well enough. When you see me switch off the safety, I'm going to try to take a shot. I'm not going to shoot until I see the bull broadside.

Fields.MenuText: We've been waiting here a long time.
I'm getting cold.
You just stare off in the distance the entire time?

Fields.DialogueText: Unless you plan on running down your prey, hunting is mostly waiting.
You should have put on warmer layers. You can get cold pretty easily from just sitting around.
It's good for learning how to focus. I don't want to miss anything. I can't hear a moose walking from this far away.
Now, here comes a bull. I'm taking the safety off...
Wait, is that-
*BOOM*
@BATTLE
What if you don't see anything?
Then you pack up and come back. You're in the moose's house. It doesn't have to greet you.
Damn Morganas! That would have been perfect!
Maybe you can put one of their heads above your fireplace.
Place of honor like that? Not even. I respect my prey.
I still can't get over what a great shot that was, Hull.
The moose, I mean. Your Morgana work was already pretty well documented.
Told you. Ain't no one got a better shot than me.
Now, then, I'd better send an officer for my moose.
Just one?
Now the real work begins. I've got to cape this guy and start butchering him. Where are my rubber clothes?
You're going to butcher the moose too?
Certainly am. It brings me closer to the animal. While hunting is a thrill, I don't hunt just for sport.

Fields.MenuText: Can I help?
Gross. I don't want to watch.
The sight of blood makes me feel dizzy.

Fields.DialogueText: Sure. Just put on some rubber boots and clothes you don't mind getting dirty.
Hey, that's fine. I'll be busy for the next day or two when I'm not battling. It's going to look like a warzone here.
That's unfortunate. How do you deal with battles or injured crew?
Say, set the course to New York. That's where the taxidermist is. I want to get this beast mounted.
*ALARM*
UURRGG. Don't let those BFs ruin the rack on my moose!
@BATTLE
You're right. I'll send two.
Can you preserve it until our tour takes us there?
Suppose so. Just need some cold storage for-
New York sure is fun to visit, even if there aren't many flowers and wildlife.
What are you hiding there?
It's a piece of cheesecake I had requisitioned.
We just need to have an officer drop my moose off at a taxidermist. I can't wait to mount him over the fireplace.

Fields.MenuText: Again with the fireplace.
How did you snag that piece of cheesecake?
What's that smell? You're wearing your perfume again, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm getting one one way or another. Just gotta rig another chimney.
Belles always have a trick or two up their sleeve. And maybe one or two officers to share with.
Figured the occasion was right. It's not every day you bag something this size.
I did manage to get some flowers from my hunting trip. Look at these lovely bunch of lupines. A lupine to go with my cervine.
The moose?
The moose. All part of the plan for the reunion.
If your sisters are anything like you, you'll be back together in no time with a hell of a show-and-tell.
That's the pact we made.

Fields.MenuText: I find your wilderness skills, well... very impressive. Can you teach me?
Well, let's keep the hunt going. But no more tigers.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I can. But I won't go easy, you know. You have to treat nature right. She's pretty, but she can be merciless.
Ha! No promises, Cap... but I'll keep the big beasts under wraps. You deal with the small fry.
The show-and-tell?
We were all supposed to be deployed to Pearl Harbor before this nonsense kicked off. Now we're scattered to the four winds.
So we figured as long as we're scattered, we might as well take a little bit of our corners of the world with us. If we've each got a story to tell, it'll be worth the trouble.
Tigers, moose, and cheesecake, eh?
And that's just the beginning.
And we'll both deal with the Morganas.
I count those among the small fry. As long as we keep up the good work, it can stay that way.
Takes one to know one.
Well, well. You're a quick study. This oughta be fun.
